Certainly! There are several books that focus specifically on Ringo's experience with the Beatles. One of the most popular is "Ringo: With a Little Help" by Michael Seth Starr. 

This book is based on extensive interviews with Ringo, his family, friends, and collaborators, as well as archival material and secondary sources. It provides an in-depth look at Ringo's life and career, from his early years as a drummer in Liverpool to his time with one of the greatest bands of all time.

The book covers Ringo's relationships with the other members of the Beatles, his struggles with addiction and other personal challenges, and his enduring impact on music and popular culture. It also includes rare photos and memorabilia, as well as insights from other musicians and celebrity fans.

Overall, "Ringo: With a Little Help" is an engaging and well-researched book that provides readers with a fascinating glimpse into Ringo's life and his contributions to the Beatles' legacy. It is an excellent starting point for fans who are interested in learning more about his experiences with the band.
